author: Brian Cheung
description: Nintendo Switch 2 draws long lines and excited gamers ahead of release
title: Nintendo Switch 2 draws long lines and excited gamers

author: Ashley Capoot, CNBC
description: Reddit is suing artificial intelligence startup Anthropic for what it’s calling a breach of contract and for engaging in “unlawful and unfair business acts” by using the social media company’s platform and data without authority.
title: Reddit sues AI startup Anthropic for breach of contract, ‘unfair competition’

author: Gary Grumbach
description: A federal judge ordered the Trump administration Wednesday to provide hundreds of migrants sent to CECOT, a maximum-security terrorism confinement center in El Salvador, with habeas relief, ordering the government to give them opportunities to challenge their detentions and removals under President Donald Trump's invocation of the Alien Enemies Act.
title: Judge orders Trump administration to provide due process to some migrants deported to El Salvador

author: Julia Ainsley
description: Immigration and Customs Enforcement made the highest number of arrests in a single day in its history on Tuesday, detaining more than 2,200 people.
title: ICE arrests record number in single day, including hundreds at scheduled appointments

author: Erik Ortiz
description: This is a free article for Diddy on Trial newsletter subscribers.
title: 'I'm the devil': Witness testifies that Diddy made threats, held her over balcony

author: Peter Nicholas
description: Just days after he left his role as one of Trump’s closest advisers, Elon Musk has launched a campaign to sink the tax and spending bill tied to Trump's policy agenda.
title: Emboldened and out of government, Elon Musk emerges as a problem for the Trump White House

author: Tim Stelloh
description: Three girls believed to have been killed by their father were found zip-tied and with plastic bags over their heads in a remote part of Washington state, according to court documents obtained Wednesday.
title: Grim details revealed in the deaths of three Washington girls as the search for their father continues

author: The Politics Desk
description: In today’s edition, Bridget Bowman speaks with Kirsten Gillibrand, the chair of Senate Democrats’ campaign arm, about how the map is shaping up ahead of next year’s midterm elections.
title: How Senate Democrats' campaign chair sees the 2026 map: From the Politics Desk

author: Bridget Bowman
description: Democrats will have to win some red states if they have any hope of taking control of the Senate next year, and the senator tasked with leading that effort believes President Donald Trump has given them an opening after he won those states easily months ago.
title: Senate Democrats' campaign chief says 'every state's on the table' in fight for majority

author: Kalhan Rosenblatt
description: For many Puerto Ricans, the nightly chirping of “coh-KEE” — the sound of a tiny frog known as the coquí — is like a national lullaby.
title: Puerto Rican coquí frogs are loud. Islanders want to keep it that way.

author: Curtis Bunn
description: The grieving parents of a 7-year-old child who died hours after being hit by a car were charged with involuntary manslaughter after allowing him and his brother, 10, to walk home unaccompanied by an adult from a nearby grocery store.
title: Parents are charged after their son, 7, is struck dead in a car accident

author: The Associated Press
description: BOULDER, Colo. — A federal judge issued an order Wednesday to prevent the deportation of the wife and five children of an Egyptian man charged in the firebombing attack in Boulder, Colorado.
title: U.S. judge issues order stopping the deportation of Boulder suspect's family

author: Diana Olick, CNBC
description: As more parts of the world face intense drought, new technologies are emerging to clean and reuse existing water.
title: This California startup is cleaning water and removing CO2 from the atmosphere — all at a reduced cost

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: The case of a 19-year-old Mexico-born college student in Georgia who ended up in a detention center following a mistaken traffic stop shows what millions of Dreamers are facing.
title: College student's immigration detention highlights Dreamers' growing deportation risks

author: Jeff Cox, CNBC
description: The U.S. economy has contracted over the past six weeks as hiring has slowed and consumers and businesses worried about tariff-related price increases, according to a Federal Reserve report Wednesday.
title: Fed 'Beige Book' economic report cites declining growth, rising prices and slow hiring

author: Reuters
description: The money will be used “to provide a free flight home and an exit bonus to encourage and assist illegal aliens to voluntarily depart the United States,” the State Department said.
title: State Department shifts $250 million from refugee aid to ‘self-deportations’

author: Rebecca Cohen
description: The Trump administration said Wednesday that it has notified the accreditor for Columbia University that the school violated Title VI, threatening the university's accreditation status by saying it "no longer appears to meet the Commissions accreditation standards."
title: Trump admin claims Columbia violated Jewish students' rights, threatens school's accreditation

description: The Department of Education says Columbia University has violated federal anti-discrimination laws stemming from the handling of campus protests of the Israel-Hamas war. NBC News' Yamiche Alcindor reports on the meaning of the alleged violation of Title VI protections.
title: Trump administration accuses Columbia University of violating anti-discrimination laws

author: Rebecca Shabad
description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump said Wednesday that Russian President Vladimir Putin told him that Moscow would retaliate against Ukraine's major drone attack over the weekend, casting doubt that a peace deal to end the war could come soon.
title: Trump says Putin told him he'll retaliate against Ukraine, casting doubt on peace progress

author: The Associated Press
description: Nebraska Gov. Jim Pillen signed into law Wednesday a measure banning transgender students from girls' sports.
title: Nebraska is the latest state to ban transgender students from girls' sports

author: The Associated Press
description: A sports bettor who heckled Olympic champion sprinter Gabby Thomas during a Grand Slam Track event in Philadelphia over the weekend has been banned by the betting site FanDuel Sportsbook.
title: FanDuel bans bettor over heckling incident with Olympic champion Gabby Thomas

author: Matt Lavietes
description: "Dance Moms" star Abby Lee Miller sued a prominent Los Angeles hospital on Tuesday, alleging that doctors left a foreign object in her body after performing surgery.
title: 'Dance Moms' star Abby Lee Miller says catheter was left in her abdomen for years, sues hospital

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: The body of a 58-year-old hiker was found Tuesday on Mount Katahdin in Maine, days after he and his daughter were reported missing.
title: Hiker found dead on Maine mountain as search is ongoing for missing daughter

author: Jason Abbruzzese
description: Satellite images of destroyed and damaged military aircraft on Russian bases have provided fresh detail into Ukraine’s recent unprecedented drone attack on its powerful neighbor.
title: Satellite images show destruction of Russian planes by Ukraine's drones

author: Megan Lebowitz
description: Former White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre, a prominent fixture in Democratic politics and the face of the Biden administration, is leaving the party and registering as an independent, according to a press release about her upcoming book.
title: Karine Jean-Pierre, Biden's former press secretary, says she's leaving the Democratic Party

author: David K. Li
description: The Edmonton Oilers, again, hope to ice this curse and bring an NHL title back to the Great White North as they take on the Florida Panthers in a Stanley Cup rematch.
title: Frozen in time: No Canadian hockey team has won the Stanley Cup since 1993

author: Kate Dore, CFP, CNBC
description: The average 401(k) plan savings rate recently notched a record high — and the percentage is nearing a widely used rule of thumb.
title: The average 401(k) savings rate hit a record high. See if you’re on track.

author: Ashley Capoot, CNBC
description: OpenAI on Wednesday announced that it now has 3 million paying business users, up from the 2 million it reported in February.
title: OpenAI tops 3 million paying business users, launches new features for workplace

author: The Associated Press
description: A record amount of sargassum piled up across the Caribbean and nearby areas in May, and more is expected this month, according to a new report.
title: Scientists say a record amount of seaweed hit the Caribbean and nearby areas in May

author: Courtney Reagan, CNBC
description: A nationwide coordinated crackdown on retail crime — what authorities are calling the first of its kind — led to hundreds of arrests in 28 states last week.
title: Nationwide coordinated retail crime crackdown results in hundreds of arrests, authorities say

description: A forensic video expert testified in the sex trafficking trial of Sean 'Diddy' Combs in New York, which is in its fourth week of testimony. The expert walked the jury through security footage of Combs beating his then-girlfriend Cassandra Ventura at a hotel in 2016.
title: Forensic video expert testifies in Sean 'Diddy' Combs trial

author: Rob Wile
description: President Donald Trump’s overnight volley of social media posts revealed his frustrations with decision makers whose cooperation he needs to secure some of his top economic objectives.
title: Trump airs frustrations with Xi and Powell over elusive economic goals

description: Watch live coverage of the New York City mayoral primary debate where nine candidates will take the stage.
title: Watch live: New York City mayoral primary debate

description: Speaker Mike Johnson, R-La., spoke to reporters about Elon Musk's recent opposition to the spending bill passed by House Republicans for President Trump's agenda.
title: Johnson says Musk's criticism of GOP spending bill is 'way off'

author: The Associated Press
description: Coco Gauff overcame 10 double-faults and the first set she's dropped in the tournament to beat Madison Keys 6-7 (6), 6-4, 6-1 at the French Open on Wednesday, reaching the semifinals for the third time.
title: Coco Gauff reaches the French Open semifinals

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Chris Pratt and Nick Offerman offered their condolences after the death of their "Parks and Recreations" castmate Jonathan Joss, who played Chief Ken Hotate.
title: Chris Pratt and Nick Offerman mourn death of 'Parks and Recreation' castmate Jonathan Joss

author: Tom Winter
description: A man was arrested at John F. Kennedy International Airport in New York City overnight in connection with the car bombing last month outside a Palm Springs fertility clinic, two people familiar with the matter said.
title: Man arrested at N.Y. airport in connection with Palm Springs fertility clinic bombing

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Singer Jessie J revealed she has been diagnosed with early breast cancer.
title: Singer Jessie J says she was diagnosed with early breast cancer and will have surgery

author: Anna Kaplan, TODAY
description: Gracie McGraw, the daughter of country music stars Tim McGraw and Faith Hill, said she has been an “out and proud queer, bisexual woman” after tabloid media said she had come out in an Instagram post.
title: Tim McGraw and Faith Hill's daughter says she's 'out and proud queer' in Pride Month post

description: By putting emotional well-being at the center of the classroom, this San Antonio, Texas school is helping students bounce back from learning loss, build resilience, and re-engage academically. And the results are transforming lives. This episode is part of Stay Tuned’s Learning Shift series, focused on reimagining classrooms in the wake of disruption. Sponsored by Walton Family Foundation.
title: Healing Hearts, Raising Scores: How One School Centers Emotional Wellness

author: Sahil Kapur
description: The nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office also found that the House-passed legislation would increase the number of people without health insurance by 10.9 million by 2034.
title: GOP bill for Trump's agenda would add $2.4 trillion to the debt over 10 years, budget office says

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: New York City said it is standing behind a Bronx high school student from Venezuela who was detained last month by immigration agents after attending a routine court hearing.
title: NYC says it will support Bronx student from Venezuela detained after attending immigration hearing

author: The Associated Press
description: Edmund White, the groundbreaking man of letters who documented and imagined the gay revolution through journalism, essays, plays and novels has died. He was 85.
title: Edmund White, a groundbreaking gay author, dies at 85

author: The Associated Press
description: The woeful Colorado Rockies have ended their ignominious, record-setting MLB streak of 22 consecutive series losses, which dated to last season.
title: Rockies' win over the Marlins ends MLB-record streak of series losses

author: Reuters
description: A federal judge on Tuesday ruled the U.S.
title: Federal judge says prisons must provide gender-affirming care for inmates

author: Greg Rosenstein
description: Learn more about the upcoming NBA Finals as the Indiana Pacers face the Oklahoma City Thunder. See odds, predictions, how to watch, channel, what time it starts and more.
title: A guide to the NBA Finals as the Thunder and Pacers clash for championship crown

author: Jo Yurcaba
description: “State of Firsts,” a documentary about Sarah McBride’s election as the first openly transgender member of Congress, will be premiered at the Tribeca Film Festival.
title: Documentary explores Sarah McBride’s historic first months in Congress

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Newlyweds Jonathan Joss and Tristan Kern de Gonzales held each other in their final moment together on Sunday.
title: Records detail neighborhood disputes before Jonathan Joss' killing

description: After an unprecedented drone assault on air bases deep inside Russia, Ukraine forces set off underwater explosives on the Kerch Bridge to Crimea, another of Vladimir Putin’s prized possessions. Hours after the bombing, Ukraine made a push for sanctions and security assistance with lawmakers in Washington. NBC’s Keir Simmons reports for TODAY.
title: Ukraine Makes Push for Sanctions After Bombing Bridge to Crimea

author: Patrick Smith
description: At least one person died in rising floodwaters in Texas overnight, authorities said, as the Midwest and parts of the South were battered by storms, flooding and suspected tornadoes.
title: One dead in Texas and dozens rescued in the Midwest as severe storms bring dangerous floods

author: Chantal Da Silva
description: Roads leading to Gaza’s aid distribution centers in will be considered “combat zones,” the Israeli military warned.
title: Gaza aid centers close for a day as Israel declares roads to sites 'combat zones'

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: A sweeping new ICE operation shows how Donald Trump’s focus on immigration is reshaping federal law enforcement.
title: New ICE deportation operation and possible dwarf planet discovery: Morning Rundown

author: The Associated Press
description: Israeli soldiers on Monday barred journalists from entering villages in the West Bank on a planned tour organized by the directors of the Oscar-winning movie “No Other Land.”
title: Israeli soldiers bar media from visiting West Bank villages on tour organized by Oscar winners

author: Reuters
description: North Korea appears to have returned to an upright position its stricken Choe Hyun Class destroyer that partially capsized during a botched launching ceremony.
title: North Korea pulls capsized warship upright after botched launch, report says

author: Reuters
description: The United States will scale down its military presence in Syria to one base from eight and U.S. policies will shift in the country “because none of them worked” over the last century, the new U.S. special envoy has said.
title: The U.S. military will cut 7 out of 8 bases in Syria, Trump administration envoy says

author: Alexander Smith
description: Russia will likely surpass 1 million casualties in its war on Ukraine this summer, according to one of the world’s leading think tanks.
title: Almost 1 million Russian troops killed or wounded in Ukraine war, study says

author: The Associated Press
description: A French police officer will face trial next year on charges of voluntary homicide over the killing of a 17-year-old of North African descent, a death that set off nationwide riots.
title: A French police officer will face trial over the killing of a teen that set off nationwide riots

author: Denise Chow
description: A possible new dwarf planet has been discovered at the edge of our solar system, so far-flung that it takes around 25,000 years to complete one orbit around the sun. The object, known as 2017 OF201, was found by researchers at the Institute for Advanced Study and Princeton University who were searching for “Planet Nine,” a hypothetical planet larger than Earth that is thought to orbit beyond Neptune.
title: Jupiter, Saturn and… 2017 OF201? Astronomers spot a possible small addition to our solar system

author: Julia Ainsley
description: In mid-May, White House deputy chief of staff Stephen Miller, frustrated over what he saw as numbers of arrests and deportations of unauthorized immigrants that were too low, berated and threatened to fire senior Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials if they did not begin detaining 3,000 migrants a day, according to two sources who spoke to attendees.
title: Sweeping new ICE operation shows how Trump is reshaping federal law enforcement

author: Brandy Zadrozny
description: Anti-vaccine activists seized on a measles outbreak in Seminole, Texas, and turned the small Mennonite city into a battleground between fringe doctors and mainstream medicine.
title: How measles tore through a remote West Texas city

author: The Associated Press
description: A judge denied a request to keep proceedings private in a divorce case for a Hawaii anesthesiologist accused of attempting to kill his wife on a hiking trail.
title: Judge denies privacy in divorce case of Maui doctor charged with attempting to kill his wife

author: The Associated Press
description: Law enforcement discovered a cache of weaponry and armor, including a machine gun and grenade launchers, along with Nazi paraphernalia during a raid of a home in Washington state, authorities said Tuesday.
title: FBI discovers cache of guns, armor and Nazi paraphernalia while raiding home in Washington state

author: Rob Wile
description: One of America's most storied industries is getting a massive boost from President Donald Trump's latest tariffs push — at the potential cost of a broader slowdown elsewhere in the U.S. economy.
title: Trump ratchets up steel tariffs to 50%

author: The Associated Press
description: Four decades after the blockbuster film debuted, the guitar's creator has launched a search for the iconic Cherry Red Gibson ES-345.
title: Where's Marty McFly's guitar? Search is on for 'Back to the Future' prop 4 decades later

author: The Associated Press
description: LOS ANGELES — Los Angeles County on Monday agreed to pay $2.7 million to a teenager who was attacked by at least six other young people at a juvenile detention center in so-called "gladiator fights" that were allegedly facilitated by probation officers.
title: Los Angeles County will pay $2.7M to teen  attacked in 'gladiator fights' at detention facility

author: Angela Yang
description: Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni’s legal squabble over her claims of emotional distress hit a roadblock Tuesday when a federal judge refused to let Lively dismiss them on her preferred terms, instead telling both sides to reach an agreement.
title: Judge tells Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni to work out dispute over dismissal of claims

author: Dennis Romero
description: On Tuesday, the Arkansas Department of Corrections distributed a photo illustration of Grant Hardin, 56, with a short beard and mustache.
title: Authorities reveal possible new look for 'Devil in the Ozarks' escapee
